results.title: Story behind the tap
results.creator_credit: Richard C. Seeger and Melbourne and Metropolitan Board of Works
results.brief_description: Covers the water supply system of Melbourne from three main catchment areas. Shows water from the catchments supplying storages, then to the suburban distribution reservoirs and finally mains distribution. The various forms of maintenance of the system, purification, and research work on supply problems to an ever-growing city are also presented.

results.title: Storms on the sun. Part one. Flare - surge events
results.creator_credit: D.G. Perrin and CSIRO. Film Unit

results.title: Storm in a teacup
results.creator_credit: Stuart McDonald and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: Cecil is retired and enjoying the twilight of his life. Freida is a widow who enjoys spending time at the local swimming pool, especially after she meets Cecil. Cecil and Freida soon become intimate companions (much to the amusement of some of Cecil’s mates from the croquet club), and Cecil becomes determined to fulfil his life-long dream of sailing to New Zealand - but is it too late? This film captures the essence of a generation who have plenty of time to enjoy themselves and is a positive look at senior citizens which illustrates that “old age” is really only as old as you feel!

results.title: Storm
results.creator_credit: Steve French and Second Banana Films
results.brief_description: The fluid boundaries between love and hate in human affairs are given concrete form in this inventive animation as figures are continually metamorphosed to the Jazz classic ‘Stormy weather’.

results.title: Stories from the earth
results.creator_credit: Katie Jennings and KCTS (Television station : Seattle, Wash.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Fire on the rim”.
In days long gone, the lack of factual explanation for the eruptions, quakes and ancilliary disasters throughout the “ring of fire”, gave rise to myths and legends as means of coping with the impact of the erratic disturbances. Cultures both old and new have been partly shaped by such events, producing beliefs affecting the social behaviour of people living with the unpredictability of the earth. This program examines some of the fascinating stories that have emerged in these communitites.

results.brief_description:
Shows children working with a teacher and making up a round-robin collaborative story, formulating characters, illustrating how they get ideas, and the importance of settings, beginnings and endings.
Suitable for primary level.

results.title: Stop or go: an experiment in genetics
results.creator_credit: Bert Shapiro and National Educational Television
results.brief_description: A documentation of an experiment which successfully analysed the genetic code of a mutant virus. Dr Norton Zinder and his colleagues at Rockefeller University, New York City, are shown as they separate the mutant viruses from non-mutants, grow new generations of the mutants, extract the mutants’ genetic materials, and test whether or not this material will manufacture a certain protein known as the coat protein.
